frameDefinitions: A Speaker succeeds in getting an Addressee to believe or plan to execute the Content the Speaker has in mind.
In this frame either a Stimulus brings about a particular emotion or experience in the Experiencer or  saliently fails to bring about a particular experience.
This frame concerns an Evaluee being judged for its quality, i.e. how much it would probably be liked.
In this frame an Evaluee is described by a (usually implicit)
In this frame an Evaluee is judged by a (usually implicit)
A Killer or Cause causes the death of the Victim.
frameExamples: At one point, Walter tries to <t>convince</t> his wife that he has had a story accepted by BBC Radio.
That was very <t>righteous</t> of you to help him.
It was <t>nice</t> of you to send a card.
listRoleDefinitions: The person that the Speaker seeks to influence to act.
The person who intends through the use of language to get another person to act.
The wish for action on the <fen>Addressee</fen>'s part that the <fen>Speaker</fen> expresses.
A piece of written or spoken material that changes the mind of the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
The general item or items that are the focus of the <fen>Content</fen> of the <fen>Speaker</fen>'s message.
When the <fen>Speaker</fen> suades the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
The location where the Speaker suades the Addressee.
The <fen>Stimulus</fen> is the object or event which brings about the emotion in the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
The <fen>Evaluee</fen> is being judged for its quality.
This role marks expressions that denote a scalar property of the <fen>Evaluee</fen> with respect to which the <fen>Evaluee</fen> is judged.
This is the person whose <fen>Behavior</fen> is being judged with respect to its morality.
The assessment of the <fen>Evaluee</fen> is based on his or her <fen>Behavior</fen>.
The <fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part or action by a body part which is the basis of the evaluation of morality.
The <fen>Evaluee</fen> is the person whose <fen>Behavior</fen> towards other human beings is being evaluated.
The <fen>Affected_party</fen> is the entity which is positively or negatively treated by the <fen>Evaluee</fen>.
The <fen>Behavior</fen> is the action of the <fen>Evaluee</fen> on which the evaluation of the <fen>Evaluee</fen>'s character is based.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the situation or person that the <fen>Evaluee</fen>'s <fen>Behavior</fen> responds to or is related to.
The <fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part or action by a body part which indicates the character of the <fen>Evaluee</fen>.
The individual whose point of view is taken in assigning the evaluation denoted by the target.
The person or sentient entity that causes the death of the <fen>Victim</fen>.
The living entity that dies as a result of the killing.
An inanimate entity or process that causes the death of the <fen>Victim</fen>.
The method or action that the <fen>Killer</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen> performs resulting in the death of the <fen>Victim</fen>.
The device used by the <fen>Killer</fen> to bring about the death of the <fen>Victim</fen>.
The point or period of time within which the <fen>Victim</fen> is killed.
The location where the death took place.
listRoleExamples: <fex>His speech</fex> convinced me to join the Peace Corps.
You haven't convinced me <fex>about that yet</fex>.
The Beaujolais Nouveau is dazzling <fex>in freshness</fex>.
It was honorable <fex>of Jackie</fex> to give up the position.
<fex>Accepting that money</fex> was immoral of Lindsay.
His face twisted into an evil <fex>grin</fex>
<fex>In my book</fex>, that wasn't very gracious.
<fex>The rockslide</fex> killed nearly half of the climbers.
The flood exterminated the rats <fex>by cutting off access to food</fex>.
It's difficult to suicide <fex>with only a pocketknife</fex>.
There is no evidence that the royal family was killed <fex>during the destruction</fex> at this site.
Apparently there were two murders <fex>in Atherton</fex> in one week.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: Thought Reform and the Psychology of Totalism
